form.features.instruments.description: if the sport uses instruments, e.g. skateboard, rackets, etc.
form.features.composition.description: if this is a compositorical sport, transitioning from one skill to another
form.language.description: To stay within the language of the sport
form.group.description: Some sports have specific names to group their skills
form.instrument.description: How does a sport call his instruments? E.g. racket, skateboard, etc.
form.position.description: Usually just 'position' but some sports may have a specific word for that
form.transition.description: Sport specific label for their transitions

instrument.form.manipulative.description: An instrument which is used to manipulate a passive-reactive movendum, e.g. a racket to play a ball
instrument.form.supportive.description: An instrument that supports the athlete itself, e.g. skies or a bike
instrument.form.movendum.description: An instrument which is moved and handled, e.g. a skateboard, unicycle

form.description.placeholder: One or two sentences desribing the {skill}
form.history.placeholder: Some history about that {skill}, e.g. who invented the {skill} or what's the story behind?
form.multiple.description: Serves as abstract Idea. Concrete multiples contain the multiplier degree.
